intro: Leuzea longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf leuzea, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces yellowish to brownish composite flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Leuzea longifolia is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
